moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 Nc6: !?Odd defense. What do you call this? I think it is called the Mexican attack or the bogo?
moves.3. Nf3 e6 4. e3 d5 5. Nc3 Bd6: A sort of Queen's gambit decline if you will. The knight on c6 is ugly and his bishop is hemmed in by its own pawn
moves.6. Qc2 dxc4 7. Bxc4 a6 8. a4 Nb4 9. Qb1: ? he should have played c5 disputing the center
moves.11. Nxd6: giving me the chance to exchange
moves.11... cxd6 12. Bd2 Nbd5 13. g4: !!! The gambit after the Queen's gambit! This is my winning move. The rest of the game is a matter of Technique. Now I am not being cocky and of course black can still win.
moves.14. Rg1 h5 15. h3 Qf6 16. Ke2: !!! of course not resetting my bishop to e2
moves.16... Nh6 17. Qd3: Queen d3 is safe now due to bishop d2
moves.19... Kh8: ?? Could he have a made a better attack or defensive move?
moves.21. Qa3 Qxc2 22. Qxf8+: Notice that I had connected rooks and his c8 bishop was still undeveloped blocking in his rook on a8. Had he develop this attack would have been nullified

gameName: The sort of Queen's Gambit Decline
